According to the planned savings, in the form of produced energy from renewable sources, the estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions will be for 1. 686,714 tCO2/year (calculated CO2 level before project implementation is 1148,445 t per year), 2. 214,757 tCO2/year (CO2 level before implementation is 372,454 t per year) and 3. 73,254 tCO2/year (CO2 level before implementation is 100,873 t per year). The project is in line with the Territorial Plan of Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska and the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040. The project also provides for the use of modern information and communication technologies, such as ICT and ICT, to monitor installed RES devices and report any problems with RES installations. The system will be adapted for all groups of people in terms of horizontal policies. The project also includes activities to increase the knowledge of residents in the field of energy transition and climate change and extensive promotion of the project in order to reach the widest possible audience of the project result. The target group of the planned project are the residents of the Commune of Strzałkowo, the Commune of Lądek and the Commune of Ostrowite, who play a double role as main stakeholders and as direct users of the infrastructure created as a result of the project, as well as other residents of the region who, thanks to the installation of RES, will be able to benefit from the implementation of the main objective of the project, which is to improve environmental protection.

label: jUŚt transition - Potential of the University of Silesia as a basis for Just Transition of the region
category_labels: Support for tertiary education (excluding infrastructure)
description: The aim of the project is to strengthen the potential of the University of Silesia in Katowice for effective support for the just transition and future staff of the region, which will be achieved through the implementation of activities affecting the institutional development of the university and by providing individual support to people constituting the academic community. Institutional development will include strengthening the human resources and infrastructure capacity of the Career Office, Doctoral Schools and Faculties of the University of Silesia associated with the process of change - with the directions of the green and digital economy. Individual support will be provided to students, teachers, PhD students and representatives of the socio-economic environment. Thanks to the project, the university will have the opportunity to create and develop new directions of industry such as artificial intelligence, VR, cybersecurity, green chemistry and energy, biotechnology and environmental protection. The project will be implemented by 30 months in the period 1.01.2024-30.06.2026 in the area of mines of one of the subregions of the Silesian Voivodeship: Katowice, Sosnowiec, Thousands, Bytom, Gliwice, Rybnik, Bielsko. The project includes: support for the Career Office, activities for the development of scientific staff, including doctorates (including implementation) and doctoral schools, support for cooperation between scientific units and entrepreneurs in the field of innovation and technology transfer, promotion of the idea of entrepreneurship, increasing the attractiveness of the University by equipping scientific laboratories and laboratories, support for the University's staff regarding, among others, the use of modern teaching methods, shaping soft and digital competences, skills for transformation through participation in courses, trainings, workshops, study visits, as well as the organization of internships and student internships in fields related to the green and digital economy, which are a response to diagnosed problems of the target group. Promotion and information activities will be carried out by the Management Team, which will constantly cooperate in this respect with the Centre for the Promotion of the University of Silesia. Various information channels will be used, including social media, the main website of the University of Silesia. Information and promotion activities will be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (EU) 2021/1060 and the Guidelines on information and promotion of European Funds for 2021-2027. Before the start of the recruitment of project participants, information and promotion activities will be implemented, among others, via the website of the University of Silesia (the home page is responsive, in accordance with the requirements of the W3C ad. accessibility and directives. EP AND COUNCIL (EU) 2016/2102 of 26.X.2016), social media (eg. Facebook, Instagram), newsletters and emails to UŚ employees – meeting digital accessibility standards and information meetings. The implementation of these actions will contribute to the wide availability of information on the project and planned support. The information and promotion campaign will be conducted in accordance with information and promotion accessibility standards, i.e. all information about events will be digitally available and will contain information that is non-stereotypically formulated. Information meetings will be organised in rooms that meet accessibility standards and will be organised in such a way as to allow the specific needs of participants to be reported. Information about the meetings will include contact details for the organiser (at least 2 contact channels) and an indication of how the event will be accessible to persons with disabilities. http://www.us.edu.pl

label: Social services for residents of the Wałbrzych subregion supported by the JTF affected by the negative effects of the transition
category_labels: Promoting social integration of people at risk of poverty or social exclusion, including the most deprived and children
description: The main objective of the project is to improve access to social and care services relevant to increasing the professional activity of excluded people and their families affected by the negative effects of the transition, including people whose inactivity results from the need to care for dependent persons and to counteract the social exclusion of people in vulnerable situations on the labour market by using the potential of social economy entities. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES - increasing access to social and care services and improving the quality of social life for 20 people (12K,8M) at risk of poverty or social exclusion in need of support in everyday functioning by, inter alia, increasing the availability of community-based social services, including care services, and - increasing access to social services and improving the quality of social and working life for 20 real carers (12K,8M) at risk of poverty or social exclusion through participation in the "Carer of a dependent person" course and psychological support. The implementation of services assumes the organization of a comprehensive program including care services in the place of residence for 20 UP (12K,8M), specialized care services for 20 UP (12K,8M), support for 20 actual caregivers (12K,8M) through the possibility of acquiring competences / qualifications within the course of a caregiver for dependent people and individual psychological counseling. Implementation of the tasks is planned in the period 01.01.2024r.-30.06.2025r. Increasing the comprehensiveness of support for residents of the Wałbrzych subregion covered by JTF support requiring assistance in everyday functioning will be achieved through an increase in the number of places where care services are provided at the place of residence. The implementation of the project will additionally contribute to increasing the quality of life of people in need of support in everyday functioning, including people with disabilities, through access to high-quality social services. Project type 9.1.A Prevention of exclusion from the labour market, which includes the following scope: the development of personal assistance and care services (including specialised care services) for people in need of support in their day-to-day functioning, together with accompanying support increasing the chances of independent living, provided in the local community for care services and specialised care services provided at home; support for the staff of social assistance and inclusion institutions in the field of education, including training and practical activities and exchange of experience for actual carers, including but not limited to improving their skills in caring for people in need of support in everyday functioning; and counselling, including psychological counselling and assistance in obtaining information to navigate the different support systems needed to provide quality care and relieve the burden on actual carers; d) deinstitutionalization of entities providing round-the-clock support: - residential care services and specialised care services. MAIN RESULTS Number of service places created in the local community: 20 Number of persons who obtained a qualification after leaving the programme: min.16 Number of jobseekers after leaving the programme: min.16 The project will be implemented under the European Funds for the Transformation of Mining Areas in Lower Silesia programme;Just Transition Fund;Priority 9 European Funds for the Transformation of Mining Areas in Lower Silesia; Action 9.1Social transformation;type:9.1.A Preventing exclusion from the labour market. The project complies with the Rules and Regulations and the Detailed Description of the Priorities of the European Funds for Lower Silesia Programme 2021- 2027.
